message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.IR 

Reasoning: The paper discusses a model for reference resolution, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of discursive and perceptual context, which suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) techniques, making cs.AI a likely sub-category as well. The model proposed in the paper also involves handling diverse phenomena, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.LG (Learning) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper's focus on reference resolution could also make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
